firstTimeDescPG1.message: This extension helps protect your privacy by automatically managing cookies.
firstTimeDescPG1.description: Description paragraph 1 seen on the first time setup page.

firstTimeDescPG2.message:
- **Function**: Keeps cookies essential for website functionality and removes cookies that track your data.
- **Remove cookie notices**: CookieBlock does not remove or interact with cookie banners. Use other extensions like [Consent-O-Matic](https://github.com/cavi-au/Consent-O-Matic), [I don’t care about cookies](https://www.i-dont-care-about-cookies.eu/), or [uBlock Origin](https://ublockorigin.com/) with Annoyances filters for that functionality.
- **Troubleshooting:** If you notice website issues (e.g., login problems or reappearing cookie notices), you can in CookieBlock popup:
  - *Add Domain Exemption* to stop removing cookies.
  - *Pause Cookie Removal*, which completely stops CookieBlock's functionality until it is resumed.
firstTimeDescPG2.description: Description on the first time setup page in a list.

firstTimeNextStepsHeader.description: Header for the next steps part of the first time setup page.

firstTimeNextStepsDesc.message:
1.  **Pin CookieBlock**: To quickly access the statistics and manage exceptions via its icon.
![how to pin the extension](/static/installation_pin.gif)
2.  **Explore Settings**: For advanced users, customize CookieBlock via settings below.
3. **Categorize and Remove Stored Cookies**: Run the extension on all currently stored cookies, and close the initial setup tab.

consentDescription.message: **Customize Your Cookie Preferences:** Select the types of cookies you want to permit. You can change these settings anytime.

catNecessaryDesc.message: Required for essential website functions like registration or shopping carts. They are always enabled for a smooth and problem-free browsing experience.

catFunctionalityDesc.message: Enable non-essential convenience or usability features of a website, such as saving style preferences. May include minor tracking cookies. Recommended for improved user experience.

catAnalyticsDesc.message: Used to collect statistical information about how visitors use a website. This information is often used to measure the performance and guide the development of a website, but can include sensitive data and allow user tracking, although usually limited to a single site. Disable these if you are concerned over potential trackers from analytics services.

catAdvertisingDesc.message: Used to tailor advertisements, track the user, and collect sensitive data of the user's browsing behavior, usually across multiple websites. Said data is often sold to third parties. We recommend rejecting these types of cookies to protect your privacy.

historyConsentTitle.description: Description for the cookie history consent toggle.

historyConsentDesc.message: Store on your computer history of cookies to improve CookieBlock functionality. This history is inaccessible to other people.
historyConsentDesc.description: Description for the cookie history consent checkbox.

historyWhy.description: Short question that allows showing more details.

historyConsentDescDetailed.message: Storing the history improves CookieBlock's prediction accuracy by collecting more detail on how websites use your cookies. It also allows CookieBlock to show you statistics of how many cookies were removed. Disable this option, if you are worried about these example scenarios. Your browser history can be observed by someone untrusted using the same computer (same browser profile); a security breach can leak the data in your browser; or border control can access your unlocked devices. In all of these scenarios, the adversary would be able to observe also cookies that expired or were manually removed by you.

cookieConfigDescPG1.message: On this page you can define custom categories for each individual cookie, which will take precedence before the classifier. Click on the list entry to display the cookies that were created by that domain. Transparent labels are temporary and were assigned by the classifier. Opaque labels are permanent and were assigned by the user. By selecting 'Recategorize', a new class will be predicted the next time the cookie is observed.
